Class CarpetLayer5_11

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • kareltherobot.UrRobot
        • kareltherobot.Robot
          • CarpetLayer5_11
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, kareltherobot.Directions
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComplexCarpetLayer5_12
    public class CarpetLayer5_11
extends kareltherobot.Robot
    The robot carpets small rooms if the room has walls on three sides with an opening for the entrance. There is a series of rooms that are both "in-line" and connected by a hallway that is on Street 1. As written, the rooms run north and south, with the entrance at the most southern point on Street 2. This version models itself after Racer.
    Version:
    06.21.2021
    Author:
    Saloni Shah

    • Constructor Detail

      • CarpetLayer5_11

        public CarpetLayer5_11​(int avenue,
                       int street,
                       kareltherobot.Directions.Direction direction,
                       int beepers)
        Creates a Carpet5_11 object at a particular location and direction with a given number of beepers.
        Parameters:
        street - specifies the vertical position on the grid of this robot
        avenue - specifies the horizontal position on the grid of this robot
        direction - specifies the direction of this robot
        beepers - specifies this robot's number of beepers

    • Method Detail

      • turnRight

        public void turnRight()
        Makes a 90 degree turn clockwise.

      • turnAround

        public void turnAround()
        Turns the robot 180 degrees.

      • faceSouth

        public void faceSouth()
        Turns the robot to face south.

      • enterRoom

        public void enterRoom()
        Enters the room.
        Precondition:
        This robot's position is at the base of the room with the potential room to the robot's left.
        Postcondition:
        This robot's position is in the room's entrance facing the hypothetical back wall.

      • exitRoom

        public void exitRoom()
        Exits the room.
        Precondition:
        This robot's position is somewhere in the room and its direction is not predescribed.
        Postcondition:
        This robot's position is just outside of the room's entrance on 1st Street. The room is to the robot's left and this robot is facing the end of the row of rooms. Teacher's notes: this method is like glideDown except the precondition is very different

      • leftIsClear

        public boolean leftIsClear()
        Tests if there is a wall to the left of this robot.
        Postcondition:
        This robot is facing the same direction as when it entered the method.
        Returns:
        true if there is no wall to the left; otherwise, false

      • rightIsClear

        public boolean rightIsClear()
        Tests if there is a wall to the right of this robot.
        Postcondition:
        This robot is facing the same direction as when it entered the method.
        Returns:
        true if there is no wall to the right; otherwise, false

      • doBothSidesExist

        public boolean doBothSidesExist()
        Determines whether there is a wall to the left and right.
        Postcondition:
        This robot is facing the same direction as it came in.
        Returns:
        true if walls exist to this robot's right & left; otherwise, false.

      • canRoomBeCarpeted

        public boolean canRoomBeCarpeted()
        Determines whether the room can be carpeted.
        Precondition:
        This robot's position is on the 1st Street and facing the end of the row of rooms.
        Postcondition:
        This robot's position is just outside of the room's entrance on 1st Street. The room is to this robot's left and this robot is facing the end of the row of rooms.
        Returns:
        true if the room can be carpeted; otherwise, false

      • putDownCarpet

        public void putDownCarpet()
        Lays the carpet down for the length of the room.
        Precondition:
        This robot is in the room and has enough beepers.
        Postcondition:
        This robot is facing the end of the room.

      • carpetRoom

        public void carpetRoom()
        Carpets room that has an opening at the entrance.
        Precondition:
        This robot is not in the room, is facing the end of the hallway, and has enough beepers.
        Postcondition:
        This robot has carpeted the room, has exited the room, and is facing the end of the hallway.

      • checkAndCarpetRoom

        public void checkAndCarpetRoom()
        Moves the robot forward one intersection, carpetting a room if appropriate.
        Postcondition:
        This robot has moved one intersection closer to the end of the room.

      • carpetAllRooms

        public void carpetAllRooms()
        Carpets all the rooms.
        Precondition:
        This robot is at first intersection and facing the end of the hallway, and this robot has enough beepers.
